item.title: Euro Bin Issue, 29th September
item.description:
Once again I have to report this, see picture. This euro bin is constantly being left in the pavement, blocking the way, and someone is seemingly opening it turfing everything out all over the place. Why, I don't know. This is happening every week. Can you please find out who it belongs to and get it removed or have a locked top attached.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Faversham Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 145 and 123 Granville Road NW6, 29th September
item.description:
Squatters left Litter bag in front of 145 Granville Road and Pillows and Fly tip in front of 123 Granville Road NW6 5AR. Elderly Resident at 145 Granville Road Litter bag STREWN outside her door NEEDS CLEARING. 123 Granville Road Pillows and Fly Tip NEED CLEARING ASAP

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Granville Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple issues, 29th September
item.description:
I am writing on behalf of local residents to formally raise concerns regarding the ongoing neglect and deterioration of Murthering Lane and the adjoining Curtis Mill Lane. The area has become increasingly affected by issues such as: Persistent fly-tipping and littering Severely overgrown vegetation and under-maintained landscape Poor road surface conditions Lack of adequate street lighting and signage These conditions not only diminish the appearance of the local area but also compromise the safety and well-being of residents. We respectfully urge the council to adopt Murthering Lane in its near-future improvement plans. Specifically, we request consideration for: Full resurfacing of Murthering Lane and Curtis Mill Lane Installation of adequate street lighting Improved road signage Regular landscape maintenance including cutting back overgrown trees and hedges Introduction of pedestrian footpaths for resident safety Installation of ANPR cameras to deter illegal dumping and antisocial behaviour These improvements are vital to restoring the safety, cleanliness, and accessibility of the area for all who live here. We appreciate your attention to this matter and hope that Murthering Lane will be included in upcoming plans for local infrastructure and environmental improvements.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Murthering Lane, Navestock, Brentwood
Report on FixMyStreet
